ownerId.description: The ID of the owner for this image. This should match the owner of the service as well as the owner of any specified registry credential.

registryCredentialId.description: Optional reference to the registry credential passed to the image repository to retrieve this image.

imagePath.description: Path to the image used for this server (e.g docker.io/library/nginx:latest).

min.description: The minimum number of instances for the service

max.description: The maximum number of instances for the service

percentage.description: Determines when your service will be scaled. If the average resource utilization is significantly above/below the target, we will increase/decrease the number of instances.
Determines when your service will be scaled. If the average resource utilization is significantly above/below the target, we will increase/decrease the number of instances.

numInstances.description: For a *manually* scaled service, this is the number of instances the service is scaled to. DOES NOT indicate the number of running instances for an *autoscaled* service.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The ID of the service

post.description: Creates a build preview instance for an image-backed service. The preview uses the settings of the base service (referenced by `serviceId`), except settings overridden via provided parameters. You can view all active previews from your service's Previews tab on the Render Dashboard. Note that you can't create previews for Git-backed services using the Render API.

imagePath.description: Must be either a full URL or the relative path to an image. If a relative path, Render uses the base service's image URL as its root. For example, if the base service's image URL is `docker.io/library/nginx:latest`, then valid values are: `docker.io/library/nginx:<any tag or SHA>`, `library/nginx:<any tag or SHA>`, or `nginx:<any tag or SHA>`. Note that the path must match (only the tag or SHA can vary).

name.description: A name for the service preview instance. If not specified, Render generates the name using the base service's name and the specified tag or SHA.

plan.description: The instance type to use for the preview instance. Note that base services with any paid instance type can't create preview instances with the `free` instance type.

ownerId.description: The ID of the owner for this image. This should match the owner of the service as well as the owner of any specified registry credential.

registryCredentialId.description: Optional reference to the registry credential passed to the image repository to retrieve this image.

imagePath.description: Path to the image used for this server (e.g docker.io/library/nginx:latest).

min.description: The minimum number of instances for the service

max.description: The maximum number of instances for the service

percentage.description: Determines when your service will be scaled. If the average resource utilization is significantly above/below the target, we will increase/decrease the number of instances.
Determines when your service will be scaled. If the average resource utilization is significantly above/below the target, we will increase/decrease the number of instances.

registry.description: The registry to use this credential with

username.description: The username associated with the credential

numInstances.description: For a *manually* scaled service, this is the number of instances the service is scaled to. DOES NOT indicate the number of running instances for an *autoscaled* service.

min.description: The minimum number of instances for the service

max.description: The maximum number of instances for the service

400.description: The request could not be understood by the server.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

403.description: You do not have permissions for the requested resource.

404.description: Unable to find the requested resource.

500.description: An unexpected server error has occurred.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: The ID of the service

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to begin retrieving entries for this query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of items that can be returned

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter for the status of the job (`pending`, `running`, `succeeded`, or `failed`)

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Filter for jobs created before a certain time (specified as an ISO 8601 timestamp)

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Filter for jobs created after a certain time (specified as an ISO 8601 timestamp)

parameters.name: startedBefore
parameters.description: Filter for jobs started before a certain time (specified as an ISO 8601 timestamp)

parameters.name: startedAfter
parameters.description: Filter for jobs started after a certain time (specified as an ISO 8601 timestamp)

parameters.name: finishedBefore
parameters.description: Filter for jobs finished before a certain time (specified as an ISO 8601 timestamp)

parameters.name: finishedAfter
parameters.description: Filter for jobs finished after a certain time (specified as an ISO 8601 timestamp)

404.description: Unable to find the requested resource.

500.description: An unexpected server error has occurred.

400BadRequest.description: The request could not be understood by the server.

401Unauthorized.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

402PaymentRequired.description: You must enter payment information to perform this request.

403Forbidden.description: You do not have permissions for the requested resource.

404NotFound.description: Unable to find the requested resource.

406NotAcceptable.description: Unable to generate preferred media types as specified by Accept request header.

409Conflict.description: The current state of the resource conflicts with this request.

410Gone.description: The requested resource is no longer available.

500InternalServerError.description: An unexpected server error has occurred.

RateLimitRemaining.description: The number of requests left for this time period.
